{{Description|In an unremarkable part of [[Belleau Region]], you and [[Paimon]] hear a loud boom...}}
'''Spino Doubleblaster''' is an [[Event]] in [[Version 4.7]].

==Event Details==
{{Domain Infobox
|type         = Event
|mapicon      = Icon Dialogue Spino Doubleblaster.png
|description  = The engineer Brest is testing the Improved Crocomorph Vortex-Based Crocodilian-armored Heavy Naval Battleship-style Recreational Water Blasting Cannon on the outskirts of Fontaine. She is all too happy to let others experience the joys the Improved Crococannon can bring...
|area         = Belleau Region
|region       = Fontaine
|requiredAR   = 20
}}
===Duration===
* 2024/07/02 10:00 - 2024/07/08 03:59

===Requirements===
* [[Adventure Rank]] 20 or above
* Complete [[Archon Quest]] [[Prologue]]: Act III "[[Song of the Dragon and Freedom]]"

===Summary===
* There are a total of 8 challenges and 2 new challenges will unlock each day for the first 4 days of the event. Complete the challenges to obtain [[Primogem]]s, [[Furnishing Blueprint]] "[[Improved Crococannon]]," [[Hero's Wit]], [[Weapon Ascension Material]]s, and other rewards.
* After the event begins, 2 new stages will be unlocked every day for the first 4 days. There are a total of 8 stages.
* After starting the stage, activate the water cannon with a most peculiar appearance and hit the floating targets to complete timed shooting challenges.
* When the watercannon fires, it will consume its Energy Reserve. The Energy Reserve is slowly replenished over time, but it can also be restored by hitting EZ-Charge Balls.
* In this event, the "Improved Crococannon" is equipped with two different firing modes, and these modes can be used to handle different kinds of Target Ball setups.

===Tutorial===
{{Tutorial
|text1    = Working off of the blueprints left behind by Chatillon, the engineer Brest made improvements to this iteration of the toy watercannon, allowing it to safely use Hydro-elemental ammo for entertainment purposes.<br>When the watercannon fires, it will consume its Energy Reserve. The Energy Reserve is slowly replenished over time, but it can also be restored by hitting EZ-Charge Balls.<br>{{Color|help|You can adjust the watercannon controls under the "Settings" in the Event UI.}}
|image1   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 1.png
|text2    = There are many kinds of Target Balls: Ordinormie Balls, Tinyvantage Balls, Dual-Charged Balls, EZ-Charge Balls, and Brouhaha Balls.<br>You can view the various unique effects of these Target Balls under stage specifics.
|image2   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 2.png
|text3    = Hitting Target Balls successively within a fixed amount of time will build your Combo. Maintaining a high Combo is key to getting a high score...
|image3   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 3.png
|text4    = In each attraction, the "Improved Crococannon" is equipped with {{Color|help|two different firing modes,}} and these modes can be used to handle different kinds of Target Ball setups.<br>Standard Mode consumes less energy, while Overdrive consumes more energy, and causes an explosion when Target Balls are hit.
|image4   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 4.png
|text5    = Destroying Ordinormie Balls and Tinyvantage Balls will grant you points.<br>Destroying a Dual-Charged Ball will cause an explosion that deals DMG to nearby Target Balls and scores points.
|image5   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 5.png
|text6    = After breaking an EZ-Charge Ball, you will score points and replenish your Energy Reserve slightly. The amount restored cannot exceed the maximum energy of the Improved Crococannon.
|image6   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 6.png
|text7    = Target Balls affected by the {{Color|help|Self-Destruct Protocol}} will self-destruct after a period of time. Target Balls that self-destruct will not count toward your score.
|image7   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 7.png
|text8    = Firing a Horizontal Salvo can hit and pierce through three targets that are lined up horizontally at once. Firing a Vertical Salvo can hit and pierce through a vertical line of three at once.
|image8   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 8.png
|text9    = Destroying Brouhaha Balls will deduct points from your score and {{Color|help|end your current Combo}}.
|image9   = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 9.png
|text10   = Tenacious Blubberballs are exceptionally large Target Balls, and have very high durability, requiring multiple hits to be destroyed.<br>Destroying them will net you a ton of points, and {{Color|help|the faster you break them, the more points you get}}.
|image10  = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 10.png
|text11   = Tenacious Blubberballs will briefly expose their weak points. Only by {{Color|help|destroying a certain number of weak points}} can you cause them to enter a stunned state.
|image11  = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 11.png
|text12   = Tenacious Blubberballs will summon Ichthyfish, and have them school around itself. While Ichthyfish are present, the Tenacious Blubberball will enter the "Fortitude" state, in which it will take no damage and its durability will be periodically restored. {{Color|help|After all Ichthyfish are destroyed}} the Tenacious Blubberball will be stunned.<br>Each Ichthyfish destroyed will replenish the Energy Reserve of the Improved Crococannon.
|image12  = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 12.png
|text13   = Tenacious Blubberballs will summon Ichthyfish, and have them move around the field. While Ichthyfish are present, the Tenacious Blubberball will conceal itself and will not take any damage. {{Color|help|After all Ichthyfish are destroyed}} the Tenacious Blubberball will be stunned and it will lose its concealment.<br>Each Ichthyfish destroyed will replenish the Energy Reserve of the Improved Crococannon.
|image13  = Tutorial Spino Doubleblaster 13.png
}}
